detail.content: CCPP                                                                                                                                                                      The Center for Cosmology and Particle Physics is a unique group of faculty, students and research scientists working together on fundamental questions at the intersection of particle physics, astrophysics and cosmology.                                                                   ccpp wiki -- for gathering and communicating community information related to working in the CCPP.

CCPP                                                                                                                                                                      The Center for Cosmology and Particle Physics is a unique group of faculty, students and research scientists working together on fundamental questions at the intersection of particle physics, astrophysics and cosmology.                                                                   ccpp wiki -- for gathering and communicating community information related to working in the CCPP.

Welcome - EPP @ NYU                                                                                                                             Toggle navigation                              EPP @ NYU                        People        Research        Funding        Media & Outreach        Blog                 Archives                                  Experimental Particle Physics @ NYU                         Welcome             The Experimental Particle Physics Group at New York University is thriving!   Our primary focus is the ATLAS experiment  at the Large Hadron Collider .  We recently hired a Andy Haas, our group's fourth faculty member and a Catrin Bernius, a post-doctoral research associate. Our group has have several key roles in ATLAS .     Interested in graduate studies in physics at NYU?   Learn more       In addition to our work on ATLAS, we are also key contributors to the   APEX experiment at Jefferson Lab,  active in the LHC upgrade, and contribute to various new ideas in particle physics experiments.   Prior to joining ATLAS, we were long term members of the MILAGRO  experiment until it came to an end and gave way to the next generation HAWC experiment, and  were involved in the MECO experiment before its termination. Please have a look at our group .
